Perplexed with questions about the origin of the world, the processes of nature, and all forms of life, these early men gave the freest scope to the fancy in suggesting explanations. Thus myths originated. Though modified in countless ways, in their development, by different conditions and influences, they seem to have been primarily an attempted solution of the problems of the universe and life.
